summary: Administrative law is a crucial component of the EU legal framework, governing the actions and operations of public authorities within member states. It delineates the scope of executive power and ensures accountability in public service. This branch of law regulates the procedures through which administrative agencies create and enforce regulations, providing mechanisms for citizens to challenge administrative decisions. In the context of EU law, administrative law facilitates the harmonization of regulatory practices across member states, promoting transparency and fairness in public administration. It plays a vital role in safeguarding individual rights against potential abuses of power by public entities.
